Ontology.name: SPDX 2.1
Ontology.comment: This specification describes the SPDX® language, defined as a dictionary of named properties and classes using W3C's RDF Technology. SPDX® is a designed to allow the exchange of data about software packages. This information includes general information about the package, licensing information about the package as a whole, a manifest of files contained in the package and licensing information related to the contained files. Known issues: - File fileType cardinality should be 0 or more instead of required one.

Object.name: agent
Object.comment: Agent (eg. person, group, software or physical artifact)..

Object.name: algorithm
Object.comment: Identifies the algorithm used to produce the subject Checksum. Currently, SHA-1 is the only supported algorithm. It is anticipated that other algorithms will be supported at a later time.

Object.name: annotation
Object.comment: Provide additional information about an SpdxElement.

Object.name: annotationType
Object.comment: Type of the annotation.

Object.name: checksum
Object.comment: The checksum property provides a mechanism that can be used to verify that the contents of a File or Package have not changed.

Object.name: copyrightText
Object.comment: The text of copyright declarations recited in the Package or File.

Object.name: creationInfo
Object.comment: The creationInfo property relates an SpdxDocument to a set of information about the creation of the SpdxDocument.

Object.name: dataLicense
Object.comment: The licensing under which the creator of this SPDX document allows related data to be reproduced. The only valid value for this property is http://spdx.org/licenses/CC0-1.0. This is to alleviate any concern that content (the data) in an SPDX file is subject to any form of intellectual property right that could restrict the re-use of the information or the creation of another SPDX file for the same project(s). This approach avoids intellectual property and related restrictions over the SPDX file, however individuals can still contract one to one to restrict release of specific collections of SPDX files (which map to software bill of materials) and the identification of the supplier of SPDX files.

Object.name: describesFile
Object.comment: The describesFile property relates an SpdxDocument to the file which it describes.

Object.name: describesPackage
Object.comment: The describesPackage property relates an SpdxDocument to the package which it describes.

Object.name: downloadLocation
Object.comment: The URI at which this package is available for download. Private (i.e., not publicly reachable) URIs are acceptable as values of this property. The values http://spdx.org/rdf/terms#none and http://spdx.org/rdf/terms#noassertion may be used to specify that the package is not downloadable or that no attempt was made to determine its download location, respectively.

Object.name: externalDocumentRef
Object.comment: Any external SPDX documents referenced within an SPDX document. This property is primarily used to verify the external SPDX document reference through use of the checksum.

Object.name: externalRef
Object.comment: An External Reference allows a Package to reference an external source of additional information, metadata, enumerations, asset identifiers, or downloadable content believed to be relevant to the Package.

Object.name: fileType
Object.comment: The type of the file.

Object.name: hasExtractedLicensingInfo
Object.comment: Indicates that a particular ExtractedLicensingInfo was defined in the subject SpdxDocument.

Object.name: hasFile
Object.comment: Indicates that a particular file belongs to a package.

Object.name: licenseConcluded
Object.comment: The licensing that the preparer of this SPDX document has concluded, based on the evidence, actually applies to the package.

Object.name: licenseDeclared
Object.comment: The licensing that the creators of the software in the package, or the packager, have declared. Declarations by the original software creator should be preferred, if they exist.

Object.name: licenseException
Object.comment: An exception to a license.

Object.name: licenseInfoFromFiles
Object.comment: The licensing information that was discovered directly within the package. There will be an instance of this property for each distinct value of alllicenseInfoInFile properties of all files contained in the package.

Object.name: member
Object.comment: A license, or other licensing information, that is a member of the subject license set.

Object.name: originator
Object.comment: The name and, optionally, contact information of the person or organization that originally created the package. Values of this property must conform to the agent and tool syntax.

Object.name: packageVerificationCode
Object.comment: A manifest based verification code (the algorithm is defined in section 4.7 of the full specification) of the package. This allows consumers of this data and/or database to determine if a package they have in hand is identical to the package from which the data was produced. This algorithm works even if the SPDX document is included in the package.

Object.name: range
Object.comment: This field defines the byte range in the original host file (in X.2) that the snippet information applies to

Object.name: referenceCategory
Object.comment: Category for the external reference

Object.name: referenceType
Object.comment: Type of the external reference. These are definined in an appendix in the SPDX specification.

Object.name: relatedSpdxElement
Object.comment: A related SpdxElement.

Object.name: relationship
Object.comment: Defines a relationship between two SPDX elements. The SPDX element may be a Package, File, or SpdxDocument.

Object.name: relationshipType
Object.comment: Describes the type of relationship between two SPDX elements.

Object.name: snippetFromFile
Object.comment: File containing the SPDX element (e.g. the file contaning a snippet).

Object.name: spdxDocument
Object.comment: A propoerty containing an SPDX document.

Object.name: supplier
Object.comment: The name and, optionally, contact information of the person or organization who was the immediate supplier of this package to the recipient. The supplier may be different than originator when the software has been repackaged. Values of this property must conform to the agent and tool syntax.

Object.name: usedBy
Object.comment: Describes how the related relatedSpdxElement is used by this SpdxElement.

Object.name: licenseInfoInSnippets
Object.comment: Licensing information that was discovered directly in the subject snippet. This is also considered a declared license for the snippet.

Object.name: endPointer
Object.comment: Pointer to the end point of the range.

Object.name: reference
Object.comment: Scope within which a single pointer operates.

Object.name: startPointer
Object.comment: Pointer to the start point of the range in a compound pointer.

Datatype.name: annotationDate
Datatype.comment: Identify when the comment was made. This is to be specified according to the combined date and time in the UTC format, as specified in the ISO 8601 standard.

Datatype.name: annotator
Datatype.comment: This field identifies the person, organization or tool that has commented on a file, package, or entire document.

Datatype.name: checksumValue
Datatype.comment: The checksumValue property provides a lower case hexidecimal encoded digest value produced using a specific algorithm.

Datatype.name: contextualExample
Datatype.comment: Example for use of the external repository identifier

Datatype.name: copyrightText
Datatype.comment: The text of copyright declarations recited in the Package or File.

Datatype.name: created
Datatype.comment: The date and time at which the SpdxDocument was created. This value must in UTC and have 'Z' as its timezone indicator.

Datatype.name: creator
Datatype.comment: The name and, optionally, contact information of a person, organization or tool that created, or was used to create, the SpdxDocument. Values of this property must conform to the agent and tool syntax.

Datatype.name: date
Datatype.comment: A date-time stamp.

Datatype.name: description
Datatype.comment: Provides a detailed description of the package.

Datatype.name: documentation
Datatype.comment: Website containing the documentation related to the repository identifier

Datatype.name: downloadLocation
Datatype.comment: The URI at which this package is available for download. Private (i.e., not publicly reachable) URIs are acceptable as values of this property. The values http://spdx.org/rdf/terms#none and http://spdx.org/rdf/terms#noassertion may be used to specify that the package is not downloadable or that no attempt was made to determine its download location, respectively.

Datatype.name: example
Datatype.comment: Text for examples in describing an SPDX element.

Datatype.name: externalDocumentId
Datatype.comment: externalDocumentId is a string containing letters, numbers, “.”, “-” or “+” which uniquely identifies an external document within this document.

Datatype.name: externalReferenceSite
Datatype.comment: Website for the maintainers of the external reference site

Datatype.name: extractedText
Datatype.comment: Verbatim license or licensing notice text that was discovered.

Datatype.name: fileContributor
Datatype.comment: This field provides a place for the SPDX file creator to record file contributors. Contributors could include names of copyright holders and/or authors who may not be copyright holders yet contributed to the file content.

Datatype.name: fileName
Datatype.comment: The name of the file relative to the root of the package.

Datatype.name: filesAnalyzed
Datatype.comment: Indicates whether the file content of this package has been available for or subjected to analysis when creating the SPDX document. If “false” indicates packages that represent metadata or URI references to a project, product, artifact, distribution or a component. If set to “false”, the package must not contain any files.

Datatype.name: isOsiApproved
Datatype.comment: Indicates if the OSI has approved the license.

Datatype.name: licenseComments
Datatype.comment: he licenseComments property allows the preparer of the SPDX document to describe why the licensing in spdx:licenseConcluded was chosen.

Datatype.name: licenseExceptionId
Datatype.comment: short form license exception identifier in Appendix I.2 of the SPDX specification.

Datatype.name: licenseExceptionText
Datatype.comment: Full text of the license exception.

Datatype.name: licenseId
Datatype.comment: A human readable short form license identifier for a license. The license ID is iether on the standard license oist or the form "LicenseRef-"[idString] where [idString] is a unique string containing letters, numbers, ".", "-" or "+".

Datatype.name: licenseListVersion
Datatype.comment: An optional field for creators of the SPDX file to provide the version of the SPDX License List used when the SPDX file was created.

Datatype.name: licenseText
Datatype.comment: Full text of the license.

Datatype.name: locatorFormat
Datatype.comment: Regular expression for the format of the external repository identifier

Datatype.name: name
Datatype.comment: The full human readable name of the item. This should include version information when applicable.

Datatype.name: noticeText
Datatype.comment: This field provides a place for the SPDX file creator to record potential legal notices found in the file. This may or may not include copyright statements.

Datatype.name: originator
Datatype.comment: The name and, optionally, contact information of the person or organization that originally created the package. Values of this property must conform to the agent and tool syntax.

Datatype.name: packageFileName
Datatype.comment: The base name of the package file name. For example, zlib-1.2.5.tar.gz.

Datatype.name: packageName
Datatype.comment: Identify the full name of the package as given by Package Originator.

Datatype.name: packageVerificationCodeValue
Datatype.comment: The actual package verification code as a hex encoded value.

Datatype.name: referenceLocator
Datatype.comment: The unique string with no spaces necessary to access the package-specific information, metadata, or content within the target location. The format of the locator is subject to constraints defined by the <type>.

Datatype.name: snippetName
Datatype.comment: Identify a specific snippet in a human convenient manner.

Datatype.name: sourceInfo
Datatype.comment: Allows the producer(s) of the SPDX document to describe how the package was acquired and/or changed from the original source.

Datatype.name: specVersion
Datatype.comment: Identifies the version of this specification that was used to produce this SPDX document. The value for this version of the spec is SPDX-1.2. The values SPDX-1.0 and SPDX-1.1 may also be supported by SPDX tools for backwards compatibility purposes.

Datatype.name: standardLicenseHeader
Datatype.comment: License author's preferred text to indicated that a file is covered by the license.

Datatype.name: standardLicenseTemplate
Datatype.comment: License template which describes sections of the license which can be varied. See License Template section of the specification for format information.

Datatype.name: summary
Datatype.comment: Provides a short description of the package.

Datatype.name: supplier
Datatype.comment: The name and, optionally, contact information of the person or organization who was the immediate supplier of this package to the recipient. The supplier may be different than originator when the software has been repackaged. Values of this property must conform to the agent and tool syntax.

Datatype.name: verificationCodeExcludedFile
Datatype.comment: A file that was excluded when calculating the package verification code. This is usually a file containing SPDX data regarding the package. If a package contains more than one SPDX file all SPDX files must be excluded from the package verification code. If this is not done it would be impossible to correctly calculate the verification codes in both files.

Datatype.name: versionInfo
Datatype.comment: Provides an indication of the version of the package that is described by this SpdxDocument.

Datatype.name: seeAlso
Datatype.comment: rdfs:seeAlso is an instance of rdf:Property that is used to indicate a resource that might provide additional information about the subject resource.

Datatype.name: lineNumber
Datatype.comment: Line number within the reference starting at one.

Datatype.name: offset
Datatype.comment: Offset from the start of the reference.

Class.name: Annotation
Class.comment: An Annotation is a comment on an SpdxItem by an agent.

Class.name: AnyLicenseInfo
Class.comment: The AnyLicenseInfo class includes all resources that represent licensing information.

Class.name: Checksum
Class.comment: A Checksum is value that allows the contents of a file to be authenticated. Even small changes to the content of the file will change its checksum. This class allows the results of a variety of checksum and cryptographic message digest algorithms to be represented.

Class.name: ConjunctiveLicenseSet
Class.comment: A ConjunctiveLicenseSet represents a set of licensing information all of which apply.

Class.name: CreationInfo
Class.comment: A CreationInfo provides information about the individuals, organizations and tools involved in the creation of an SpdxDocument.

Class.name: DisjunctiveLicenseSet
Class.comment: A DisjunctiveLicenseSet represents a set of licensing information where only one license applies at a time. This class implies that the recipient gets to choose one of these licenses they would prefer to use.

Class.name: ExternalDocumentRef
Class.comment: Information about an external SPDX document reference including the checksum. This allows for verification of the external references.

Class.name: ExternalRef
Class.comment: An External Reference allows a Package to reference an external source of additional information, metadata, enumerations, asset identifiers, or downloadable content believed to be relevant to the Package.

Class.name: ExtractedLicenseInfo
Class.comment: An ExtractedLicensingInfo represents a license or licensing notice that was found in the package. Any license text that is recognized as a license may be represented as a License rather than an ExtractedLicensingInfo.

Class.name: File
Class.comment: A File represents a named sequence of information that is contained in a software package.

Class.name: License
Class.comment: A License represents a copyright license. The SPDX license list website is annotated with these properties (using RDFa) to allow license data published there to be easily processed. The license list is populated in accordance with the License List fields guidelines. These guidelines are not normative and may change over time. SPDX tooling should not rely on values in the license list conforming to the current guidelines.

Class.name: LicenseException
Class.comment: An exception to a license.

Class.name: ListedLicense
Class.comment: A license which is included in the SPDX License List (http://spdx.org/licenses).

Class.name: OrLaterOperator
Class.comment: A license with an or later operator indicating this license version or any later version of the license (e.g. GPL-2.0+)

Class.name: Package
Class.comment: A Package represents a collection of software files that are delivered as a single functional component.

Class.name: PackageVerificationCode
Class.comment: A manifest based verification code (the algorithm is defined in section 4.7 of the full specification) of the SPDX Item. This allows consumers of this data and/or database to determine if an SPDX item they have in hand is identical to the SPDX item from which the data was produced. This algorithm works even if the SPDX document is included in the SPDX item.

Class.name: ReferenceType
Class.comment: Types used to external reference identifiers.

Class.name: Relationship
Class.comment: A Relationship represents a relationship between two SpdxElements.

Class.name: SimpleLicenseingInfo
Class.comment: The SimpleLicenseInfo class includes all resources that represent simple, atomic, licensing information.

Class.name: Snippet
Class.comment: The set of bytes in a file. The name of the snippet is the name of the file appended with the byte range in parenthesis (ie: "./file/name(2145:5532)")

Class.name: SpdxDocument
Class.comment: An SpdxDocument is a summary of the contents, provenance, ownership and licensing analysis of a specific software package. This is, effectively, the top level of SPDX information.

Class.name: SpdxElement
Class.comment: An SpdxElement is any thing described in SPDX, either a document or an SpdxItem. SpdxElements can be related to other SpdxElements.

Class.name: SpdxItem
Class.comment: An SpdxItem is a potentially copyrightable work.

Class.name: WithExceptionOperator
Class.comment: Sometimes a set of license terms apply except under special circumstances. In this case, use the binary “WITH” operator to construct a new <SPDX-License-Expression> to represent the special exception situation. A valid license expression is where the left operand is a valid <SPDX-License-Expression> value and the right operand is an SPDX License List Exception Identifier (SPDX LL Exception Identifier) that represents the special exception terms. SPDX License LL Identifiers can be found on the SPDX License List. The syntax for the “WITH” operator is: <SPDX-License-Expression-2> = (<SPDX-License-Expression-1> WITH <SPDX-LL-Exception-Identifier>) For example, when the Bison exception is to be applied to GPL-2.0+, the expression would be: (GPL-2.0+ WITH Bison-exception-2.2), where: <SPDX-License-Expression-1> = GPL-2.0+ <SPDX-LL-Exception-Identifier> = Bison-exception-2.2 <SPDX-License-Expression-1> = (GPL-2.0+ WITH Bison-exception-2.2) If the applicable exception is not found on the SPDX License List, then use LicenseRef-[idString] to express the license and exception.

Class.name: ByteOffsetPointer
Class.comment: Single pointer using a byte offset from the start of the reference.

Class.name: CompoundPointer
Class.comment: An abstract method made of a pair of pointers to a defined section to be subclassed for extensibility.

Class.name: LineCharPointer
Class.comment: Single pointer using line and char numbers.

Class.name: OffsetPointer
Class.comment: Generic single pointer based on an offset.

Class.name: Pointer
Class.comment: Abstract Pointer to be subclassed for extensibility.

Class.name: SinglePointer
Class.comment: Abstract pointer to a single point to be subclassed for extensibility.

Class.name: StartEndPointer
Class.comment: Compound pointer to a range with a start and an end point.

NamedIndividual.name: annotationType_other
NamedIndividual.comment: Type of annotation which does not fit in any of the pre-defined annotation types.

NamedIndividual.name: annotationType_review
NamedIndividual.comment: A Review represents an audit and signoff by an individual, organization or tool on the information for an SpdxElement.

NamedIndividual.name: checksumAlgorithm_md5
NamedIndividual.comment: Indicates the algorithm used was MD5

NamedIndividual.name: checksumAlgorithm_sha1
NamedIndividual.comment: Indicates the algorithm used was SHA-1

NamedIndividual.name: checksumAlgorithm_sha256
NamedIndividual.comment: Indicates the algorithm used was SHA256

NamedIndividual.name: fileType_application
NamedIndividual.comment: The file is associated with a specific application type (MIME type of application/* )

NamedIndividual.name: fileType_archive
NamedIndividual.comment: Indicates the file is an archive file.

NamedIndividual.name: fileType_audio
NamedIndividual.comment: The file is associated with an audio file (MIME type of audio/* , ie. .mp3 ); IMAGE if the file is assoicated with an picture image file (MIME type of image/*, ie. .jpg, .gif )

NamedIndividual.name: fileType_binary
NamedIndividual.comment: Indicates the file is not a text file. spdx:filetype_archive is preferred for archive files even though they are binary.

NamedIndividual.name: fileType_documentation
NamedIndividual.comment: The file serves as documentation.

NamedIndividual.name: fileType_image
NamedIndividual.comment: The file is assoicated with an picture image file (MIME type of image/*, ie. .jpg, .gif ).

NamedIndividual.name: fileType_other
NamedIndividual.comment: Indicates the file is not a source, archive or binary file.

NamedIndividual.name: fileType_source
NamedIndividual.comment: Indicates the file is a source code file.

NamedIndividual.name: fileType_spdx
NamedIndividual.comment: The file is an SPDX document.

NamedIndividual.name: fileType_text
NamedIndividual.comment: The file is human readable text file (MIME type of text/*).

NamedIndividual.name: fileType_video
NamedIndividual.comment: The file is associated with a video file type (MIME type of video/*).

NamedIndividual.name: noassertion
NamedIndividual.comment: Indicates that the preparer of the SPDX document is not making any assertion regarding the value of this field.

NamedIndividual.name: none
NamedIndividual.comment: When this value is used as the object of a property it indicates that the preparer of the SpdxDocument believes that there is no value for the property. This value should only be used if there is sufficient evidence to support this assertion.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_amendment
NamedIndividual.comment: To be used when SPDXRef-A amends the SPDX information in SPDXRef-B.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_ancestorOf
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_ancestorOf expresses that an SPDXElement is an ancestor of (same lineage but pre-dates) the relatedSPDXElement. For example, an upstream File is an ancestor of a modified downstream File

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_buildToolOf
NamedIndividual.comment: To be used when SPDXRef-A is used to to build SPDXRef-B.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_containedBy
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_containedBy expresses that an SPDXElement is contained by the relatedSPDXElement. For example, a File contained by a Package.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_contains
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_contains expresses that an SPDXElement contains the relatedSPDXElement. For example, a Package contains a File. (relationshipType_contains introduced in SPDX 2.0 deprecates property 'hasFile' from SPDX 1.2)

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_copyOf
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_copyOf expresses that the SPDXElement is an exact copy of the relatedSDPXElement. For example, a downstream distribution of a binary library which was copied from the upstream package.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_descendantOf
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_descendantOf expresses that an SPDXElement is a descendant of (same lineage but post-dates) the relatedSPDXElement. For example, an downstream File that was modified is a descendant of an upstream File

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_describedBy
NamedIndividual.comment: Is to be used an SPDXRef-A is described by SPDXRef-Document.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_describes
NamedIndividual.comment: Is to be used when SPDXRef-DOCUMENT describes SPDXRef-A.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_distributionArtifact
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_distributionArtifact expresses that distributing the SPDXElement requires that the relatedSPDXElement also be distributed. For example, distributing a binary File may require that a source tarball (another File) be made available with the distribuiton.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_documentation
NamedIndividual.comment: To be used when SPDXRef-A provides documentation of SPDXRef-B.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_dynamicLink
NamedIndividual.comment: Is to be used when SPDXRef-A dynamically links to SPDXRef-B.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_expandedFromArchive
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_expandedFromArchive expresses that the SPDXElement is a file which was epanded from a relatedSPDXElement file. For example, if there is an archive file xyz.tar.gz containing a file foo.c the archive file was expanded in a directory arch/xyz, the file arch/xyz/foo.c would have a relationshipType_expandedFromArchive with the file xyz.tar.gz.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_fileAdded
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_fileAdded expresses that the SPDXElement is a file which has been added to the relatedSPDXElement package. For example, a package (the relatedSPDXElement) has been patched to remove a file (the SPDXElement). This relationship is typically used to express the result of a patched package when the actual patchfile is not present.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_fileDeleted
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_fileDeleted expresses that the SPDXElement is a package where the relatedSPDXElement file has been removed. For example, a package has been patched to remove a file a file (the relatedSPDXElement resulting in the patched package (the SPDXElement). This relationship is typically used to express the result of a patched package when the actual patchfile is not present.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_fileModified
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_fileModified expresses that the SPDXElement is a file which is a modified version of the relatedSPDXElement file. For example, a file (the SPDXElement) has been patched to modify the contents of the original file (the SPDXElement). This relationship is typically used to express the result of a patched package when the actual patchfile is not present.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_generatedFrom
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_generatedFrom expresses that an SPDXElement was generated from the relatedSPDXElement. For example, a binary File might have been generated from a source File.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_generates
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_generates expresses that an SPDXElement generates the relatedSPDXElement. For example, a source File generates a binary File.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_hasPrerequisite
NamedIndividual.comment: Is to be used when SPDXRef-A has as a prerequisite SPDXRef-B.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_metafileOf
NamedIndividual.comment: To be used when SPDXRef-A is a metafile of SPDXRef-B.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_optionalComponentOf
NamedIndividual.comment: To be used when SPDXRef-A is an optional component of SPDXRef-B.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_other
NamedIndividual.comment: to be used for a relationship which has not been defined in the formal SPDX specification. A description of the relationship should be included in the Relationship comments field.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_packageOf
NamedIndividual.comment: To be used when SPDXRef-A is used as a package as part of SPDXRef-B.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_patchApplied
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_patchApplied expresses that the SPDXElement is a 'patchfile' that was applied and produced the relatedSPDXElement. For example, a .diff File relates to a specific file where the diff was applied.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_patchFor
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_patchFor expresses that the SPDXElement is a 'patchfile' that is designed to patch (apply modifications to) the relatedSPDXElement. For example, relationship from a .diff File to a Package it is designed to patch.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_prerequisiteFor
NamedIndividual.comment: Is to be used when SPDXRef-A is a prerequisite for SPDXRef-B

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_staticLink
NamedIndividual.comment: Is to be used when SPDXRef-A statically links to SPDXRef-B.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_testcaseOf
NamedIndividual.comment: Is to be used when SPDXRef-A is a test case used in testing SPDXRef-B.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_variantOf
NamedIndividual.comment: A Relationship of relationshipType_variantOf expresses that an SPDXElement is a variant of the relatedSPDXElement, but it is not clear which came first. For example, if the content of two Files differs by some edit, but there is no way to tell which came first (no reliable date information), then one File is a variant of the other File.

NamedIndividual.name: relationshipType_dataFileOf
NamedIndividual.comment: Is to be used when SPDXRef-A is a data file used in SPDXRef-B.
